intro: Egassea, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plants are characterized by their succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Egassea species are often used in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value. They play an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small desert animals.
